alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 12:57PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Haskell and northern Throckmorton Counties through 145 PM CST... At 1257 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Irby, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Haskell, Millers Creek Reservoir, Irby, Elbert and Us- 183 Near The Throckmorton-Baylor County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
